comment: Class wasn't hard at all. It was a lot of work for it to be an elective. She also takes forever to grade.
Not a hard class by any means but a lot of work for a free elective class. Grades slowly so you don't know what you make.
A lot of assignments and busy work but it's all pretty easy. The course was informative. No final exam. You have to pay $62 to be able to access the class platform.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Pretty average teacher, she just gives what feels like an absurd amount of busy work.

Professor Patterson's Coaching Principles class is super easy, but it's a LOT of unnecessary work. Most of the work in this class is just busy work and that's really my only complaint. Luckily, she gives you about 2 weeks to complete all her assignements.
Straight forward: meet your deadlines, do your work, come to class.
This is mean for HPE3050 coaching principles but the class was very manageable and she was a fast responder to emails. Nothing was difficult but the work is a decent amount. Overall good class
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I took Professor Pattersons hybrid class and we met only once a week, so attendance was mandatory. All work was online and she was very clear about when things were due and that she doesnt take late work. The only thing she grades is your Healthy Living Check-In. Other than that, your grade in the class depends on you doing your work online.

She's an overall good teacher. She offers extra credit, however does not take any late work at all. The class is easy and the textbook is online. I was able to work ahead a lot. She is a VERY slow grader

I took her wellness class online. Overall, shes a good teacher- lectures are straight to the point. She does not take any late work at all- no exceptions!! The class is easy. There is extra credit opportunities and the grading is very straightforward. The textbook is online and you are able to kind of work ahead on the module for those weeks.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: she doesn't open up any past modules for even half credit and she honestly doesn't care about anyone failing the class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took her class as a hybrid and she is an excellent teacher. Her lectures are to the point. There is a module online for homework once every three weeks or so. They are not difficult at all. I recommend her for anyone who wants to take wellness! She is super nice and easy to contact.

I took her online class so I didn't interact with her much other than emails. DONT MISS A DUE DATE & READ INSTRUCTIONS CLEARLY! I got zeroes on two assignments because I misunderstood one & submitted one wrong document. Her "no late work" policy trumped both excuses. There are 2 EC opportunities. Pretty easy class. I did everything last minute.

Took WELL1000 online with this professor. She states clearly what's required throughout this course. We had a total of 6 modules and were required to complete a module a week. No textbook required. Grading is pretty straight forward, do the work, get an A. She also provides Extra Credit! This course was a BREEZE
She is a little extra for this basic class, but she is nice. There is an attendance grade, so show up. It's only once a week. Don't be late. Exercises are okay. She offers extra credit. READ.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Being as honest as possible, taking her is simple and straight-forward. Do the module work ea/week, simple grading. My only annoyance is not taking late assignments under any circumstance (destroyed my grade despite reasons) the amount of rudeness she portrays in her emails n lack of clarity in some. If nothing ever happens to you, you'll like her.

Very easy class to take. She gives us 2 weeks per module and offers extra credit.  Ended the class with a 102 thanks to extra credit and doing all the modules on time. She does not accept late work!!!!
Take her Hybrid. Go to every class, and read the night before  and take notes on the material for the short pop quizzes. Easy A
Took her hybrid class. Great teacher. COME TO CLASS. You will have a quiz every class. Do all your work on Bearface and you will easily pass with an A.

She made an easy course a lot harder than what it should've been. She is not clear about assignments or due dates and is sometimes rude when you email her. The content of the course is good to learn, but the overload of homework on bearface that has nothing to do with the chapters makes this class really complicated, especially for a busy student.

Patterson make this class very enjoyable and i actually learned things when she taught. Very nice professor and very understanding. I would choose her to be my teacher again if it was possible. Mainly labs that you do on your own, two projects, two exams, and lectures. Easy A

there is no reason no to receive an A in this class. four tests, she drops lowest score, about 5 labs,  in class critical thinking that you have to go to class for. extra credit opportunities, gives extra credit for attendance sometimes.  while this class should be a GPA booster she has a tendency to make things more difficult then they need to be.
